closeguardian().details: The function can be called only by the owner of the guardian and only if the guardian has not been already closed.

params.amount: Amount in native token decimals to transfer cross-chain pre-fees*
params.chainId: which chain to bridge assets onto
params.fToken: The wrapped file token to deposit into the bridge
params.to: address on other chain to bridge assets to

params.amount: Amount in native token decimals to transfer cross-chain pre-fees*
params.chainId: which chain to bridge assets onto
params.to: address on other chain to bridge assets to
params.token: ERC20 compatible token to deposit into the bridge

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

returns._0: true if the guardian is active, false otherwise.
true if the guardian is closed, false otherwise.
true if the guardian has been terminated, false otherwise.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

params.amount: Amount in native token decimals to transfer cross-chain pre-fees*
params.chainId: which underlying chain to bridge assets onto
params.fToken: The wrapped file token to deposit into the bridge
params.to: address on other chain to redeem underlying assets to

params.amount: Amount in native token decimals to transfer cross-chain pre-fees*
params.chainId: which underlying chain to bridge assets onto
params.to: address on other chain to redeem underlying assets to
params.token: ERC20 compatible token to deposit into the bridge

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params.to: Address to send the fees to
params.token: ERC20 token in which fees acccumulated to transfer

addWToken(address,address).notice: add the token to list of acceptable token for brdige

changeWToken(address,address).notice: change the token in list of acceptable token for brdige

closeguardian().notice: Closes guardian when owner decides that they no longer need it. Releases bonds to the guardian members.

depositFToken(address,uint256,address,ui.notice: Relays to nodes to transfers an ERC20 token cross-chain

depositToken(address,uint256,address,uin.notice: Relays to nodes to transfers an ERC20 token cross-chain

isActive().notice: Returns true if the guardian is active.

isClosed().notice: Returns true if the guardian is closed and members no longer support this guardian.

isTerminated().notice: Returns true if the guardian has been terminated. guardian is terminated when bonds are seized and members no longer support this guardian.

redeemFToken(address,uint256,address,uin.notice: Relays to nodes that (typically) a wrapped synAsset ERC20 token has been burned and the underlying needs to be redeeemed on the native chain

redeemToken(address,uint256,address,uint.notice: Relays to nodes that (typically) a wrapped synAsset ERC20 token has been burned and the underlying needs to be redeeemed on the native chain

removeWToken(address).notice: remove the token from list of acceptable token for brdige

withdrawFees(address,address).notice: withdraw specified ERC20 token fees to a given address
